info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 10:15AM CDT until April 7 at 6:38AM CDT by NWS Paducah KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Black River at Poplar Bluff affecting Butler County.
.A multi-day heavy rain is headed toward the region lasting through Saturday. Three days of rainfall is incorporated into the forecast but it still does not include the entire event. The Black River will start to rise tomorrow and increases in crest forecasts can be expected. Now is the time to prepare for major flooding.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record.
* WHERE...Black River at Poplar Bluff.
* WHEN...From late Friday night to Monday morning.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 3.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 3.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall to 3.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to 21.5 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO MONDAY MORNING
